probe_port.description: The name of the port to use for readiness and liveness probes. Defaults to the first port listed.

additional_iam_policies.description: A list of extra IAM role policies not captured by Opta which you wish to give to your service.

commands.description: The commands override to execute in your container (corresponds to EntryPoint in docker)

args.description: The args override to pass to your container (corresponds to Cmd in docker)

ports.description: Specifies which port(s) your app exposes.

healthcheck_command.description: See the See the [healthcheck probe](https://docs.opta.dev/reference/aws/modules/aws-k8s-service/#healthcheck-probe) section. Default `[]` (i.e., no user-specified healthchecks)

liveness_probe_command.description: Use if using shell command liveness checks and liveness probe != readiness probe

readiness_probe_command.description: Use if using shell command readiness checks and liveness probe != readiness probe

max_history.description: The max amount of helm revisions to keep track of (0 for infinite)

cron_jobs.description: A list of cronjobs to execute as part of this service

tolerations.description: Taint tolerations to add to the pods.

port.description:
Specifies what port your app was made to be listened to. Currently it must be a map of the form
`http: [PORT_NUMBER_HERE]` or `websocket: [PORT_NUMBER_HERE]`. Use `http` if you just have a vanilla http server
and `websocket` for websockets.

image.description: Set to AUTO to create a private repo for your own images. Otherwises attempts to pull image from public dockerhub

min_containers.description: The minimum number of replicas your app can autoscale to.

max_containers.description: The maximum number of replicas your app can autoscale to.

timeout.description: Time in seconds to wait for deployment.

env_vars.description:
A map of key values to add to the container as environment variables (key is name, value is value).
```yaml
env_vars:
 FLAG: "true"
```

healthcheck_path.description: See the See the [healthcheck probe](https://docs.opta.dev/reference/aws/modules/aws-k8s-service/#healthcheck-probe) section. Default `null` (i.e., no user-specified healthchecks)

liveness_probe_path.description: Use if using http ping liveness checks and liveness probe != readiness probe

readiness_probe_path.description: Use if using http ping readiness checks and liveness probe != readiness probe

initial_liveness_delay.description: Use if the initial delay needs to be changed.

initial_readiness_delay.description: Use if the initial delay needs to be changed.

sticky_session.description: Use [sticky sessions](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/10494431/sticky-and-non-sticky-sessions) via cookies for your service (first request will send you a cookie called opta_cookie which you should add on future requests).

sticky_session_max_age.description: If the sticky session is enabled, how long should the cookie last?

resource_request.description:
See the [container resources](https://docs.opta.dev/reference/aws/modules/aws-k8s-service/#resource-requests) section.
CPU is given in millicores, and Memory is in megabytes.

cpu.description: The number of CPU units to allocate.

memory.description: The amount of memory to allocate in megabytes.

resource_limits.description:
See the [container resources]({{< relref "#container-resources" >}}) section.
Memory is in megabytes..

cpu.description: The number of CPU units to allocate.

memory.description: The amount of memory to allocate in megabytes.

public_uri.description: The full domain to expose your app under as well as path prefix. Must be the full parent domain or a subdomain referencing the parent as such: "dummy.{parent[domain]}/my/path/prefix"

keep_path_prefix.description: Should we keep the prefix path which you set in the public uri when forwarding requests to your service?

links.description: A list of extra IAM role policies not captured by Opta which you wish to give to your service.

persistent_storage.description:
A list persistent storages to add to each instance of your service (need to give a `size` which is the size in GB
for the storage volume to be, and `path` which is the path in the filesystem of each instance to place it under)

ingress_extra_annotations.description: These are extra annotations to add to ingress objects

pod_annotations.description: These are extra annotations to add to k8s-service pod objects / replace defaults

pod_labels.description: These are extra labels to add to k8s-service pod objects / replace defaults
